metadata.title: CVE-2022-3970 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in LibTIFF. It has been classified as critical.This affects the function TIFFReadRGBATileExt of the filelibtiff/tif_getimage.c. The manipulation leads to integer overflow. It ispossible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed tothe public and may be used. The name of the patch is227500897dfb07fb7d27f7aa570050e62617e3be. It is recommended to apply apatch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-213549 was assigned to thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.9
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.9
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.9
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.9').
